name: Greg Abbott
tweet: The Covid positivity rate continues to plummet; now down to 5.9%. That is the lowest in almost 10 months.  Covid hospitalizations dropped below 4,000 for the first time in 5 months.  Most importantly, Covid related fatalities today are the lowest reported this year.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today 239,789 Texans got a COVID shot.  About 57% of seniors & almost 30% of Texans ages 50-64 have received a shot.  The positivity rate is 6.5%--the lowest since late September--and has been under 10% for more than 2 weeks.  Hospitalizations went down again.  Great job Texans.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas set a new one-day record by giving 270,523 COVID vaccine shots to Texans.  More than 55% of seniors have received a shot and more than 28% of Texans between 50-64 have received a shot.  COVID hospitalizations continue to decline & are at the lowest level in 5 months.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today almost 200,000 more Texans got a COVID vaccine shot.  Not only have more than 53% of our seniors received a shot, but also more than 25% of the group from 50-65 have received a shot.  Covid hospitalizations declined once again-this time to the lowest level since October 18.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: More than 225,000 Texans got a COVID vaccine shot today and well over 7 million shots have been given in Texas.  Hospitalizations are the lowest since mid-October.  The positivity rate is 6.64% -- the lowest since late Sept.  More than 52% of seniors have received a vaccine.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas is now expanding the COVID vaccine eligibility to include all Texans 50 and older--beginning March 15th.   Most seniors have already received a shot.  Seniors who have not received a shot & want one will still be prioritized.  Always voluntary.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: More than 220,000 Texans got a COVID vaccine shot today.  More than 51% of seniors have received a shot.  The positivity rate has dropped for 15 straight days & is now down to 6.64%.  Keep up the great work to crush COVID in Texas.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Covid hospitalizations declined again today  The positivity rate is the lowest since late September & has been on a downward trajectory for months.  The number of reported fatalities is the lowest in more than 2 months.  COVID has not gone away, but we can continue to crush it.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Ahead of schedule, Texas now has given vaccine shots to more than 50% of seniors.  This is important because that age group represents the overwhelming majority of COVID hospitalizations & fatalities.  Both should continue to improve with increased vaccinations of seniors.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: This week Texas is slated to get more than 1,385,000 COVID vaccines.  We urge all seniors & educators who want one to get one.  COVID-19 vaccine sign-up info:  https://t.co/H5IxJkZVyC   Also, Texans can call 2-1-1 for referral to a local provider.   Always voluntary.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Good news continues on COVID improvements:  -the COVID positivity rate is 7.09%--the lowest in 5 months.  -Hospitalizations continue to decline--at 4,721 they are the lowest since Oct. 19th.  Vaccinations rates continue to increase.  Always voluntary, never forced.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today more than 228,000 Texans got a vaccine shot--the 2nd most administered in one day.  Hospitalizations declined below 5,000 & are at the lowest level since October 20th.  The Covid positivity rate is the lowest since October 11th & has been under 10% & declining for 7 days.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today...  -more than 200,000 Texans received a vaccination shot  -COVID hospitalizations declined, as did the number of active COVID cases  -ALL 22 hospital regions in Texas are out of the danger zone  Keep up the great work to crush COVID in Texas.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: MORE good news:  COVID hospitalizations and the positivity rate both declined today.  We administered 180,914 vaccinations today and have far exceeded 6 million vaccinations altogether.  Always voluntary, never forced.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: My statement about the Biden administration assimilating Covid positive illegal immigrants in states across the country  https://t.co/PqImAihYkp

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today...Texas has the lowest COVID hospitalizations since October 24th.  The positivity rate is the lowest since October 14th--and has steadily declined for 2 straight months.  We gave a daily record of vaccinations: 229,490.  In the last week we gave 1,220,577 vaccine shots.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: All Texas school employees & childcare workers can now get the COVID vaccine.   https://t.co/sJRdsUetdf

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: The Biden Administration is recklessly releasing hundreds of illegal immigrants who have COVID into Texas communities.   The Biden Admin. must IMMEDIATELY end this callous act that exposes Texans & Americans to COVID.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: ANOTHER new daily record in vaccines administered.  Today Texas reports more than 229,000 in a single day.  The high vaccination numbers focused on our senior population will continue to reduce hospitalizations.   We are able to contain COVID and safely allow Texas to open 100%

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today I was in Corpus Christi to announce a Statewide ‘Save Our Seniors’ program to vaccinate homebound seniors across Texas.  The National Guard will support our mission to help vaccinate seniors & those who are most at risk of COVID.   ⁦@TexasGuard⁩  https://t.co/ML3d8HKijj

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas will get almost 1 million COVID vaccine doses this next week.  About 600,000 first doses & more than 350,000 second doses.  We will catch up for delays during the winter weather.  We should administer more than 5 shots million before March.   Always voluntary never forced.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 4,000,000 Covid vaccinations.  That comes just 8 days after we passed 3,000,000.  Thanks to all healthcare & frontline workers helping to achieve this success.  More vaccines are coming soon with the opening of Super Sites.  Always voluntary, never forced

tweet: Austin-based medical diagnostics company Everlywell will begin offering a home testing kit for COVID-19 early next week.  The company said 30,000 of the tests will be available starting Monday.  #txlege #coronavirus #COVID19  https://t.co/nYzKojCDjz

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Corpus Christi & Nueces County officials unveil plan & site for local COVID-19 testing.  Like many Texas areas, they haven't yet had a case of COVID-19.  But, they know it's coming & are getting prepared for testing.  #txlege  https://t.co/vxBJf7raKC

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today I fast-tracked temporary licensing of out-of-state doctors, assistants & nurses, to assist in Texas' response to COVID-19.   We will ensure Texas has all medical personnel needed to fight #coronavirus.   #COVID19 #txlele   https://t.co/N3Ae5XVlWd @woodlandsonline

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: I have waived some trucking regulations to help stores restock after supply shortages due to #coronavirus concerns.  Retailers have strong supply sources & there's no need to hoard.  Retailers are ready to restock.  #COVID-19 #txlege   https://t.co/865qIcQasr via @12NewsNow

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: A Texas lab is leading the way on #coronavirus treatment.  We have a world-class bio-containment lab in TX where the best medical minds are looking for solutions for #COVID-19.  They’re working on a coronavirus vaccine & might be close to a treatment.   https://t.co/xYDNThxNeL
